{{cpp/filesystem/path/title|begin|end}}
{{cpp/filesystem/path/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|num=1|since=c++17|1=
iterator begin() const;
}}
{{dcl|num=2|since=c++17|1=
iterator end() const;
}}
{{dcl end}}

@1@ Returns an iterator to the first element of the path. If the path is empty, the returned iterator is equal to {{lc|end()}}.
@2@ Returns an iterator one past the last element of the path. Dereferencing this iterator is undefined behavior.

The sequence denoted by this pair of iterators consists of the following:
# {{spar|root-name}} (if any).
# {{spar|root-directory}} (if any).
# Sequence of {{spar|file-name}}s, omitting any directory separators.
# If there is a directory separator after the last {{spar|file-name}} in the path, the last element before the end iterator is an empty element.

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
@1@ Iterator to the first element of the path.
@2@ Iterator one past the end of the path

{{cpp/impldef exception}}

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;filesystem&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
namespace fs = std::filesystem;

int main()
{
    const fs::path p = 
#   ifdef _WIN32
        "C:\\users\\abcdef\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\";
#   else
        "/home/user/.config/Cppcheck/Cppcheck-GUI.conf";
#   endif
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "Examining the path " &lt;&lt; p &lt;&lt; " through iterators gives\n";
    for (auto it = p.begin(); it != p.end(); ++it)
        std::cout &lt;&lt; *it &lt;&lt; " │ ";
    std::cout &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|p=true
|output=
--- Windows ---
Examining the path "C:\users\abcdef\AppData\Local\Temp\" through iterators gives
"C:" │ "/" │ "users" │ "abcdef" │ "AppData" │ "Local" │ "Temp" │ "" │

--- UNIX ---
Examining the path "/home/user/.config/Cppcheck/Cppcheck-GUI.conf" through iterators gives
"/" │ "home" │ "user" │ ".config" │ "Cppcheck" │ "Cppcheck-GUI.conf" │ 
}}
